9 Using the Dylan IDL Compiler

9.1 Introduction

The Functional Developer IDL compiler, Scepter, is available as a standalone executable called console-scepter.exe. The executable is available in the Bin subfolder of your top-level Functional Developer installation folder.

The IDL compiler reads an IDL file and generates three Dylan projects from it. The projects contain stub and skeleton code. Each project defines one of the libraries specified in the document An IDL Binding for Dylan. (See Section A.2 on page 102.)

The project's name is identical to the name of the library which it defines. By default the projects are placed in subfolders of the current working folder called protocol, stubs and skeletons.

Developing Component Software with CORBA - 26 May 1999
